Notice:

Water Bills are due by the 10th of each month.  If you did not receive your bill, call City Hall at 979-793-4253 to get your bill amount.     |     View the 2025 Hurricane Preparedness Guide for the Houston-Galveston Region.     |     Water Bills are due by the 10th of each month.  If you did not receive your bill, call City Hall at 979-793-4253 to get your bill amount.     |     View the 2025 Hurricane Preparedness Guide for the Houston-Galveston Region.

Government

General Elections

Elections Information

City of Needville - 2026 General Election

The next General Election for the City of Needville will be Saturday, May 2, 2026. Elections in the City of Needville are conducted in accordance with the Texas Election Code. For more information, contact the City Secretarys Office at 979-793-4253 or email: cynthiasullivan@cityofneedville.com

Filing Method of Candidate Application

Filing for a place on the ballot is set by state statute. Filing dates for the May 2, 2026 election is set by state statute and expected to run from January 14, 2026 to February 13, 2026 (dates are set by the Texas Election Code and are not discretionary).

A candidate application may be filed in person, by mail, by fax, or by email. The candidate application (English and Spanish) can be downloaded and printed via the Texas Secretary of States website: Application for a Place on the Ballot For a General Election

  • Filing in Person: City Hall, 9022 Main Street, Needville, TX, 77461
  • Filing by Mail: An application submitted by mail is considered to be filed at the time of its receipt by the appropriate filing authority. (Sections 143.007(b); 144.005(b)) Please be advised that an application must be notarized prior to filing via mail. The mailing address is City of Needville, Attn: City Secretary, 9022 Main Street, Needville, TX, 77461
  • Filing by Fax or Email: A signed, sworn, scanned candidate application may be submitted by fax or email. Please be advised that an application must be notarized prior to filing via fax or email.
  • Fax: 979-793-6055 (Attn: City Secretary)
  • Email: cynthiasullivan@cityofneedville.com

Find additional election-related dates and information at Texas Secretary of State - Candidate Information (posted in accordance with TX. Legis. H.B. 305, effective September 1, 2019).

Filing requirements are per state statute, available at Texas Secretary of State - Running for a Local Office.

Positions on the ballot for the May 2, 2026 election are:

  • Councilmember (Currently held by Robert Sloan)
  • Councilmember (Currently held by Wyatt Sbrusch)
  • Councilmember (Currently held by Phillip Wigginton)

These positions will serve a two-year term.

Voter registration is handled by Fort Bend County Elections Administrator and the Texas Secretary of State.

For more important information, please pick up a General Election Candidate Application packet at Needville City Hall, 9022 Main Street, Needville, Texas.
